alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dane; Iowa (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 8:28AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Iowa, southeastern Columbia and northwestern Dane Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Poynette to near Waunakee to Dodgeville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Sun Prairie, Middleton, Waunakee, Monona, Mount Horeb, Windsor, Dodgeville, Deforest, Cross Plains, Lodi, Poynette, Mazomanie, Shorewood Hills, Black Earth, Maple Bluff, Barneveld, Dane, Blue Mounds and Arena. People attending The UW Football Game in Madison should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
